Description: Large fragment from a corner of a cloth of undyed linen, and with decoration in dark mauve-blue wool and undyed linen; the survivng decoration includes a band (c.13x7.5cm, beginning 21 cm in from the corner, with outline strapwork decoration in light against dark, of triangles with twists and a rope border enclosing rosettes in its twists) and the remains of a square panel (c.5.5x8cm, at c.10 cm above the band and 29cm in from the selvedge, with related outline decoration based on a central roundel); except for 14cm at the end of the cloth, narrow space around the decoration and along the selvedge, the undyed linen ground is covered in a pile of weft loops, c.2cm long; across the end, a warp fringe is c.4cm long and held by a single row of hitches; at 2.5cm in from the fringe, a band of bare warp threads, c.2cm deep; in from this are three triple self-bands; warp-faced plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/c.22), weft-undyed linen (S/c.9); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/c.6), weft-mauve-blue wool (S/c.50); one simple selvedge, one hitched warp fringe and other edges torn or ragged; at back of tapestry, floating un-used linen warp threads and linen brocading threads; pile occurs in c. every 8th shed and consists of a groups of c.4 threads which are pulled up into plain loops after every 4,6 or 8 ends
Curator's comments: there is one piece in U15 with ref. no. missing - is this it?
